text:
Overview
This report provides a fully reproducible pipeline for processing and geocoding CNPJs from the Brazilian Federal Revenue Service (RFB).

Problem
The AcessoSAN project aims to develop methods for measuring and analyzing inequities in access to healthy food in favelas and other urban communities. Achieving this requires a reliable and up-to-date database of food retail establishments.
The Brazilian Federal Revenue Service (RFB) CNPJs database lists companies operating in Brazil, including food retail establishments. However, it does not provide geocoded information, which is required for spatial analyses. This pipeline addresses that gap by processing and geocoding the data.

Data Availability



The processed data are available in both rds and csv formats through a dedicated repository on the Open Science Framework (OSF), accessible here. A metadata file is included alongside the validated datasets. You can also retrieve these files directly from R using the osfr package.

Methods
Source of Data
The data used in this report come from the following sources:

Brazilian Federal Revenue Service (RFB): Data on food retail establishments from the CNPJ database, used for company identification.
Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE): Open spatial datasets of Brazilian addresses from the National Address Register for Statistical Purposes (CNEFE), used for geocoding via the geocodebr R package.
Data Munging
The data munging follow the data science workflow outlined by Wickham et al. (2023), as illustrated in Figure 1. All processes were made using the Quarto publishing system (Allaire et al., n.d.), the R programming language (R Core Team, n.d.) and several R packages.
Spatial data processing was performed using the terra R package (Hijmans, n.d.) and the rspatial framework. For data manipulation and workflow, priority was given to packages from the tidyverse and rOpenSci ecosystems, as well as other packages adhering to the tidy tools manifesto (Wickham, 2023).


Figure 1: Data science workflow created by Wickham, Çetinkaya-Runde, and Grolemund.


Source: Reproduced from Wickham et al. (2023).



Code Style
The Tidyverse code style guide and design principles were followed to ensure consistency and enhance readability.
Reproducibility
The pipeline is fully reproducible and can be run again at any time. To ensure consistent results, the renv package (Ushey & Wickham, n.d.) is used to manage and restore the R environment. See the README file in the code repository to learn how to run it.

Set the Environment
Load Packages

library(brandr)
library(beepr)
library(cli)
library(checkmate)
library(dplyr)
library(fs)
library(geocodebr)
library(ggplot2)
library(here)
library(htmltools)
library(magrittr)
library(osfr)
library(purrr)
library(readr)
library(rutils) # github.com/danielvartan/rutils
library(rvest)
library(stringr)
library(vroom)
library(zip)

Set Functions

map_tibble <- function(x, n_max = Inf) {
  assert_character(x, any.missing = FALSE, min.len = 1)
  assert_count(n_max, positive = TRUE)

  x |>
    map(
      \(x) vroom(
        file = x,
        delim = ";",
        col_names = FALSE,
        col_types = cols(.default = "c"),
        n_max = n_max, # For testing.
        progress = FALSE
      ),
      .progress = TRUE
    ) |>
      list_rbind()
}

Set Initial Variables

set.seed(2025)


year <- 2025


month <- 1

Unzip Data

zip_files <- raw_data_dir |> dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "\\.zip$")


zip_files |> map(\(x) unzip(x, exdir = raw_data_dir), .progress = TRUE)


zip_files |> file_delete()

Read the Data
Set Parameters

n_max <- 10 # For testing.

Companies

company_data <-
  raw_data_dir |>
  dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "\\.EMPRECSV$") |>
  map_tibble(n_max = n_max) |>
  rename_with(
    \(x) c(
      "cnpj_basic",
      "company_name",
      "legal_nature",
      "responsible_qualification",
      "company_share_capital",
      "company_size",
      "responsible_federal_entity"
    )
  )


company_data |> glimpse()
#> Rows: 100
#> Columns: 7
#> $ cnpj_basic                 <chr> "41273592", "41273593", "41273594", "412…
#> $ company_name               <chr> "41.273.592 HELIO DE JESUS PEREIRA", "JU…
#> $ legal_nature               <chr> "2135", "2135", "2135", "2135", "2135", …
#> $ responsible_qualification  <chr> "50", "50", "50", "50", "50", "50", "50"…
#> $ company_share_capital      <chr> "30000,00", "3000,00", "5000,00", "3000,…
#> $ company_size               <chr> "01", "01", "01", "01", "01", "01", "01"…
#> $ responsible_federal_entity <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, …

Establishments

establishment_data <-
  raw_data_dir |>
  dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "\\.ESTABELE$") |>
  map_tibble(n_max = n_max) |>
  rename_with(
    \(x) c(
      "cnpj_basic",
      "cnpj_order",
      "cnpj_dv",
      "branch_identifier",
      "trade_name",
      "registration_status",
      "registration_status_date",
      "registration_status_reason",
      "foreign_city_name",
      "country",
      "start_date",
      "cnae_primary",
      "cnae_secondary",
      "street_type",
      "street_name",
      "number",
      "address_complement",
      "neighborhood",
      "postal_code",
      "federal_unit",
      "municipality_tom",
      "phone_area_code_1",
      "phone_number_1",
      "phone_area_code_2",
      "phone_number_2",
      "fax_area_code",
      "fax_number",
      "email",
      "special_status",
      "special_status_date"
    )
  )


establishment_data |> glimpse()
#> Rows: 100
#> Columns: 30
#> $ cnpj_basic                 <chr> "37220018", "36068186", "37318263", "373…
#> $ cnpj_order                 <chr> "0001", "0001", "0001", "0001", "0001", …
#> $ cnpj_dv                    <chr> "09", "68", "53", "25", "70", "98", "99"…
#> $ branch_identifier          <chr> "1", "1", "1", "1", "1", "1", "2", "1", …
#> $ trade_name                 <chr> "ANTONIO HERCULANO DA MOTA", NA, NA, NA,…
#> $ registration_status        <chr> "08", "02", "02", "08", "02", "04", "08"…
#> $ registration_status_date   <chr> "20230530", "20200120", "20200604", "202…
#> $ registration_status_reason <chr> "01", "00", "00", "01", "00", "63", "01"…
#> $ foreign_city_name          <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, …
#> $ country                    <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, …
#> $ start_date                 <chr> "20200525", "20200120", "20200604", "202…
#> $ cnae_primary               <chr> "8712300", "4330499", "1629301", "522909…
#> $ cnae_secondary             <chr> NA, NA, "3101200", NA, "4781400,8599604,…
#> $ street_type                <chr> "RUA", "RUA", "RUA", "RUA", "RUA", "TRAV…
#> $ street_name                <chr> "ARCO-IRIS", "JOSE PEREIRA MARQUES", "JO…
#> $ number                     <chr> "97", "390", "568", "441", "201/19", "36…
#> $ address_complement         <chr> NA, NA, NA, "CASA 03", "SALA 03", NA, NA…
#> $ neighborhood               <chr> "PARQUE BOTUJURU", "JARDIM COUNTRY CLUB"…
#> $ postal_code                <chr> "09821090", "37704313", "09920140", "097…
#> $ federal_unit               <chr> "SP", "MG", "SP", "SP", "SP", "SP", "MG"…
#> $ municipality_tom           <chr> "7075", "5035", "6377", "7075", "7075", …
#> $ phone_area_code_1          <chr> "11", "35", "11", "11", "11", "11", "35"…
#> $ phone_number_1             <chr> "41014141", "99939878", "80594733", "433…
#> $ phone_area_code_2          <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, …
#> $ phone_number_2             <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, …
#> $ fax_area_code              <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, …
#> $ fax_number                 <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, …
#> $ email                      <chr> "HERCULANOANTONIO23@GMAIL.COM", "ALEVIDR…
#> $ special_status             <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, …
#> $ special_status_date        <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, …

Shareholders

shareholder_data <-
  raw_data_dir |>
  dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "\\.SOCIOCSV$") |>
  map_tibble(n_max = n_max) |>
  rename_with(
    \(x) c(
      "cnpj_basic",
      "shareholder_identifier",
      "shareholder_name",
      "shareholder_cpf_cnpj",
      "shareholder_qualification",
      "entry_date_in_company",
      "country",
      "representative_cpf",
      "representative_name",
      "representative_qualification",
      "age_range"
    )
  )


shareholder_data |> glimpse()
#> Rows: 100
#> Columns: 11
#> $ cnpj_basic                   <chr> "66011180", "66011180", "85061877", "8…
#> $ shareholder_identifier       <chr> "2", "2", "2", "2", "2", "2", "2", "2"…
#> $ shareholder_name             <chr> "CLAUDIO RONDINI", "MARIA APARECIDA QU…
#> $ shareholder_cpf_cnpj         <chr> "***887038**", "***933348**", "***5219…
#> $ shareholder_qualification    <chr> "49", "22", "49", "22", "49", "22", "4…
#> $ entry_date_in_company        <chr> "20011126", "20050618", "20060202", "2…
#> $ country                      <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA…
#> $ representative_cpf           <chr> "***000000**", "***000000**", "***0000…
#> $ representative_name          <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA…
#> $ representative_qualification <chr> "00", "00", "00", "00", "00", "00", "0…
#> $ age_range                    <chr> "8", "7", "4", "5", "5", "5", "8", "7"…

Shareholder Qualifications

shareholder_qualification_data <-
  raw_data_dir |>
  dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "\\.QUALSCSV$") |>
  map_tibble(n_max = n_max) |>
  rename_with(
    \(x) c(
      "shareholder_qualification_code",
      "shareholder_qualification"
    )
  )


shareholder_qualification_data |> glimpse()
#> Rows: 10
#> Columns: 2
#> $ shareholder_qualification_code <chr> "00", "05", "08", "09", "10", "11", …
#> $ shareholder_qualification      <chr> "N\xe3o informada", "Administrador",…

CNAE

cnae_data <-
  raw_data_dir |>
  dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "\\.CNAECSV$") |>
  map_tibble(n_max = n_max) |>
  rename_with(
    \(x) c(
    "cnae_code",
    "cnae_description"
    )
  )


cnae_data |> glimpse()
#> Rows: 10
#> Columns: 2
#> $ cnae_code        <chr> "0111301", "0111302", "0111303", "0111399", "01121…
#> $ cnae_description <chr> "Cultivo de arroz", "Cultivo de milho", "Cultivo d…

Simples

simples_data <-
  raw_data_dir |>
  dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "SIMPLES.CSV") |>
  map_tibble(n_max = n_max) |>
  rename_with(
    \(x) c(
      "cnpj_basic",
      "simples",
      "simples_option_date",
      "simples_exclusion_date",
      "mei",
      "mei_option_date",
      "mei_exclusion_date"
    )
  )


simples_data |> glimpse()
#> Rows: 10
#> Columns: 7
#> $ cnpj_basic             <chr> "00000000", "00000006", "00000008", "0000001…
#> $ simples                <chr> "N", "N", "N", "S", "N", "N", "N", "S", "N",…
#> $ simples_option_date    <chr> "20070701", "20180101", "20140101", "2007070…
#> $ simples_exclusion_date <chr> "20070701", "20191231", "20211231", "0000000…
#> $ mei                    <chr> "N", "N", "N", "N", "N", "N", "N", "N", "N",…
#> $ mei_option_date        <chr> "20090701", "00000000", "00000000", "0000000…
#> $ mei_exclusion_date     <chr> "20090701", "00000000", "00000000", "0000000…

Legal Nature

legal_nature_data <-
  raw_data_dir |>
  dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "\\.NATJUCSV$") |>
  map_tibble(n_max = n_max) |>

legal_nature_data |> glimpse()
#> Rows: 10
#> Columns: 2
#> $ legal_nature_code <chr> "0000", "3271", "3280", "3298", "3301", "3999", "…

  dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "\\.PAISCSV$") |>

Municipalities

municipalities_data <-
  raw_data_dir |>
  dir_ls(type = "file", regexp = "\\.MUNICCSV$") |>

#> Rows: 10
#> Columns: 2
#> $ municipality_code <chr> "0001", "0002", "0003", "0004", "0005", "0006", "…
#> $ municipality      <chr> "GUAJARA-MIRIM", "ALTO ALEGRE DOS PARECIS", "PORT…

Citation






When using this data, you must also cite the original data sources.



To cite this work, please use the following format:
Vartanian, D., Penz, C. L. S., Fernandes, C. N., & Giannotti, M. A. (2025). A reproducible pipeline for processing and geocoding CNPJs from the Brazilian Federal Revenue Service (RFB) [Computer software]. Center for Metropolitan Studies of the University of São Paulo. https://cem-usp.github.io/rfb-cnpj-geocoding
A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is
@software{vartanian2025,
  title = {A reproducible pipeline for processing and geocoding CNPJs from the Brazilian Federal Revenue Service (RFB)},
  author = {{Daniel Vartanian} and {Clara de Lima e Silva Penz} and {Camila Nastari Fernandes} and {Mariana Abrantes Giannotti}},
  year = {2025},
  address = {São Paulo},
  institution = {Center for Metropolitan Studies of the University of São Paulo},
  langid = {en},
  url = {https://cem-usp.github.io/rfb-cnpj-geocoding}
}

Acknowledgments





This work is part of a research project by the Polytechnic School (Poli) of the University of São Paulo (USP), in partnership with the Secretariat for Food and Nutrition Security (SESAN) of the Ministry of Social Development, Family, and the Fight Against Hunger (MDS), titled: AcessoSAN: Mapping Food Access to Support Public Policies on Food and Nutrition Security and Hunger Reduction in Brazilian Cities.






This work was developed with support from the Center for Metropolitan Studies (CEM) based at the School of Philosophy, Letters and Human Sciences (FFLCH) of the University of São Paulo (USP) and at the Brazilian Center for Analysis and Planning (CEBRAP).






This study was financed, in part, by the São Paulo Research Foundation (FAPESP), Brazil. Process Number 2025/17879-2.
